SENTENCE.STRING: (4,112 m) is a mountain of the Mont Blanc massif in Italy.
:*Pointe Güssfeldt (4,112 m)*Pointe Seymour King (4,107 m)*Pointe Jones (4,104 m)
neighbour – the Aiguille Noire de Peuterey (3,773 m) –
forms part of the Peuterey ridge (Intégrale), one of the three great ridges (the others being the Innominata and Brouillard ridges) to the summit of Mont Blanc.
This was first climbed via a couloir on the Brenva face by Paul Güssfeldt with Emile Rey, Christian Klucker and César Ollier on 15–19 August 1893.
The first ascent of the complete ridge including the Aiguille Noire de Peuterey (the Intégrale) was on 28–31 July 1934 by Adolf Göttner, Ludwig Schmaderer and Ferdinand Krobath,
